results.title: How to make an American quilt
results.creator_credit: Jocelyn Moorhouse, Midge Sanford, Sarah Pillsbury and Amblin Entertainment
results.brief_description: Winona Ryder shines in this deeply moving and touchingly funny story of a Berkeley graduate student Finn (Ryder) who spends the summer at the home of her sparring Grandmother (Anne Bancroft) and great aunt (Ellyn Burstyn). Their house is a quiet haven where she intends to finish her latest thesis and think over a marriage proposal. This beautifully filmed tale brings unbridled passion, true love, betrayal, joy and heartbreak vividly to life in a captivating cinematic tapestry that celebrates finding your way and following your heart. Based on the novel by Whitney Otto.

results.title: How to make a truck
results.brief_description: Looks at the relatively small scale manufacture of trucks for specialized applications in the United States. Provides a simple but comprehensive explanation of the assembly line and the entire process of truck production.

results.title: How to make a movie without a camera
results.creator_credit: Mimi Warshaw, Michael Warshaw and Rainy Day Productions
results.brief_description: Presents the results of efforts made to produce a film without a camera, using the following techniques to produce striking effects: vegetable dye colouring, felt-tipped pen, sprays and fingerprints all individually applied to clear leader; and scratching and perforating of opaque leader. The film is especially useful to young filmmakers.

results.title: How to make a movie
results.brief_description: Although short and largely created to practise the Straford Brothers’ unique approach to editing and transitions, this already shows their ambitions for scene and story. Here, a frustrated filmmaker tries to make a ‘classic.’

results.title: How to Let Go of the World and Love All the Things Climate Can't Change
results.brief_description: When documentarian Josh Fox realises that the answers for how to respond to the degradation of our environment cannot be found in his own back yard, he travels the world to connect with communities that are already facing grave effects of climate change.

constellations_other.name: Freedom from surveillance
constellations_other.description: Real world and cinematic authoritarianism and resistance explored through documentaries, Hollywood blockbusters, TV and videogames.

results.title_for_label: How to Let Go of the World and Love All the Things Climate Can’t Change
results.description: When documentarian Josh Fox realizes, after much soul searching, that the answers for how to respond to the degradation of our environment cannot be found in his own back yard, he travels the world to connect with communities that are already facing grave effects of climate change. What he finds is a complicated mix of tragedy and inspiration in the various ways climate change is affecting our value systems. How to Let Go of the World delivers a sobering portrait of the state of climate change, and takes stock of what makes humans survivors, and our societies so creative and resilient.
description_for_label: When documentarian Josh Fox realizes, after much soul searching, that the answers for how to respond to the degradation of our environment cannot be found in his own back yard, he travels the world to connect with communities that are already facing grave effects of climate change. What he finds is a complicated mix of tragedy and inspiration in the various ways climate change is affecting our value systems. How to Let Go of the World delivers a sobering portrait of the state of climate change, and takes stock of what makes humans survivors, and our societies so creative and resilient.

results.title: How to kill your husband
results.brief_description: Shirley’s father, a skilled mechanic and excellent drummer, suffered from heart disease. Shirley retells her father’s history, from the struggles of growing up during the depression to his now proud children, grandchildren and great-grandchildren. Made as part of ‘The Heart of the Story’ in association with Vic Health and the Heart Foundation.
